replies.bodyText: Good point. I actually saw this as a bug. 😄 My understanding was, that we need to allow that a user can remove its own ownership for an entity. That means the sharing user needs to be in the active shares and shown in the list of users in the share dialog. If we exclude the current user from the active shares, we need a different way for allowing a user to remove its own ownership.
replies.author: bernd

replies.bodyText:
From a UX perspective, I'd say this will clutter the UI, because it's a rare condition.
But we can keep the API generic. The frontend could still hide it..

replies.bodyText: Not sure, but I thought it also didn't hurt at the moment. I also don't see a reason not to use GRNs for that. What's your thinking behind that?
replies.author: bernd

replies.bodyText:
To clarify: My thinking was, that we might need to allow modification of capabilities (e.g. adding new permissions from plugins).
Now that I spelled it out... Extending capabilities will probably an internal thing without user interaction, so we also don't need permissions for that. 😄
